bibl.title: The territory of Washington vs. Donald Fallon Frank Rogers. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: The territory of Washington vs. Donald Fallon Frank Rogers. Writ of Habeas Corpus
msIdentifier.collection: King County Government, Judicial Administration, Territorial District Court Case Files, 1867-1889

div1.p: In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District. County of King Territory State of Washington In the matter of the application of Donald Fallon and Frank Rodgers for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Order granting Writ.

Upon reading and filing the petition of Donald Fallon and Frank Rodgers duly signed and verified by them whereby it appears that they are is illegally imprisioned and restrained of their liberty by Lewis Wyckoff the Sheriff of King County aforesaid at the county jail in the said county of King in the territory of Washington and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue.

It is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District court of the sem 3rd Judicial District of Washington territory directed to the said Lewis v. Wyckoff commanding him to have the bodies of the said Donald Fallon and Frank Burkes before me at my chambers in said King County on the 6th day of July A. D. 1876, at 6 o'clock ...M... of that day, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered conerning the said Donald Fallon and Frank Rodgers together with the time and cause of their detention and that you have them and there said writ.

Dated July 6th A. D. 1876
Judge of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial County of King W. J. J. R. Lewis Judge

District Court 3rd Judicial District County of King, In the matter of the application of Donaled Fallon and Frank Rodgers for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Order granting Writ. Filed July 6 A. D. 1876 Beniah Brown
